# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Data

wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines")

Here is the Julia code to solve your problem:

```julia
function wrap_string(str::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(str, " ")
    result = ""
    current_line = ""

    for word in words 
        if length(current_line * " " * word) > text_width
            result *= "\n" * current_line
            current_line = ""
        end
        current_line *= " " * word
    end

    result *= "\n" * current_line
    return result
end

print(wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines", 15))
```

When you run this code, it should print:

`This function`  
`will wrap`  
`words into`  
`lines`
